prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We propose a CO line search, which requires a wide range of frequency coverage. Therefore, we need the widest spectral window. The CO line width (FWHM) emitted by star forming galaxies is typically wider than a few 100 km/s, therefore our request is sufficient.

We detect SXDF-ALMA3 as the point-like source because we want to maximize sensitivity. SXDF-ALMA3 is not resolved in our ALMA 1.1 mm continuum survey (synthesized beam size = 0.5" x 0.4"). Therefore, we request the angular resolution > 1" and the largest angular scale = 1", which can be realized by C36-1, 2 and 3 at band 3.

We aim a 5-sigma detection of a CO line with a velocity resolution of 100 km/s under the worst condition of estimated flux. The CO luminosity is derived from the IR luminosity of SXDF-ALMA3, log(L_IR/L_sun)~12.0, which is estimated from 1.1 mm observed flux density (T = 35 K, beta = 1.5). Assuming SXDF-ALMA is a star forming galaxy, not merging, we use the L_IR-L'_CO(1-0) relation, logL_IR=1.15logL'_CO(1-0)+0.13, descrived in Genzel et al. (2010). When we assume M82 CO excitation ladder (Weiss et al. 2005) and the Gaussian profile with FWHM = 400 km/s, the estimated peak flux density is shown in Figure 4 of Science Justification. In the worst case at Tuning 1, z = 3.11, the estimated CO(3-2) peak flux denisty is 0.925 mJy. Therefor, we need sigma = 185 uJy to achieve > 5-sigma detection.
Assuming the CO line is the Gaussian prodile with FWHM = 400 km/s, which is typical value for star forming galaxies, the bandwidth = 100 km/s is sufficient.

Assuming the CO line is the Gaussian prodile with FWHM = 400 km/s, which is typical value for star forming galaxies, the bandwidth = 100 km/s is sufficient.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We propose to conduct a blind search of the CO emission lines toward SXDF-ALMA3 wich is discovered by ALMA 1.1 mm deep observations of contiguous 1.5 arcmin^2 window in the SXDF-UDS-CANDELS field, with 5 sigma sensitivity of 0.28 mJy. One of the brightest ALMA source, SXDF-ALMA3 (the target), is very dark in deep WFC3/HST and HAWK-I/VLT NIR images as well as VLA 1.4 GHz and 6 GHz images, despite the fact that this source rather bright (0.84 +/- 0.09 mJy in 1.1 mm, corresponds to L_IR ~ 1 x 10^12 L_sun or SFR ~ 170 M_sun/yr), which suggests that ALMA deep surveys can unveil dust obscured star forming galaxies which are difficult to identify even with the deepest NIR/radio surveys. The main aim of this proposal is as follows:
(1) Determining its redshift by scanning CO lines across the band 3 to test whether SXDF-ALMA3 is significantly above the star-formation main sequence at its epoch or not.
(2) Revealing the molecular gas mass fraction of SXDF-ALMA3 to assess its star formation mode.
Through the proposed observation, we aim to characterize the nature of this dusty starburst galaxy which is can only be understood via deep ALMA spectroscopy.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
